predicate.note: Frames file for 'preoccupy' based on sentences in wsj. Verbnet entry 31.1 (verbs of emotion).

roleset.name: demand full attention

example.name: usually passive
example.text: Worst of all, Nissan was preoccupied *trace* with management infighting, cronyism and corporate rigidity.
example.arg: management infighting, cronyism and corporate rigidity

example.name: occasionally active
example.text: Foreign exchange dealers said that the currency market has begun to distance itself from the volatile stock exchange, which *trace* has preoccupied the market since Oct. 13, when the Dow Jones Industrial Average plunged more than 190 points.
example.arg: since Oct. 13, when the Dow Jones Industrial Average plunged more than 190 points

roleset.note: Note that the focus of attention cannot be regarded as an arg0 'agent' because it cannot be introduced by the usual preposition in passive sentences: *Nissan was preoccupied by cronyism.
